The Gerund and Gerundive

342. The following essential points of difference between the gerund and gerundive may be of service to beginners :—

1. The gerund is a verbal noun, the gerundive a verbal adjective.

2. The gerund, being a verbal noun, may stand alone or with an object.

3. The gerundive as a verbal adjective is used only in agree· ment with a noun.
